alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 2:44PM MST until December 15 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 4 inches, except between 3 and 6 inches above 7,500 feet. The heavier amounts are likely to occur along the foothills of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHERE...Central Highlands, Santa Fe Metro Area, and Upper Rio Grande Valley. * WHEN...Until 2 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Santa Fe Metro Area; Upper Rio Grande Valley
